abstract: Historian Taylor Branch has emerged as a vocal critic of the National Collegiate Athletic Assn; his Atlantic Magazine essay skewers the organization for exploiting athletes in revenue sports like football and basketball to make hundreds of millions of dollars while expounding the virtues of amateurism.
snippet: The October issue of The Atlantic featured an article by Taylor Branch on the N.C.A.A. titled “The Shame of College Sports.” The thesis was the exploitation of athletes in top revenue sports.
lead_paragraph: The October issue of The Atlantic featured an article by Taylor Branch on the N.C.A.A. titled “The Shame of College Sports.” The thesis was the exploitation of athletes in top revenue sports.

headline.main: After Leaving Football, a Historian Emerges as an N.C.A.A. Critic
headline.print_headline: After Leaving Football, A Historian Emerges As an N.C.A.A. Critic
headline.seo: Historian Taylor Branch Delivers a Critical View of the N.C.A.A.
